post.date: Posted: Wed Oct 11, 2006 5:24 pm Post subject: declManager->FindSkin
post.author: Giganoto
post.body:
Does anybody know how I can check that it actually found the skin?

I thought it would return null when it didn't find the skin specified, but it doesn't Even if the skin doesn't exist, it still returns an object.

So how can I use this object to check if the skin was found or not? Or even is there another way to do this?

Thanks

post.date: Posted: Wed Oct 11, 2006 5:25 pm Post subject:
post.author: Giganoto
post.body:
Sorry, wrong section, should have posted in Mod Coding... Please move this topic.

Thanks

post.date: Posted: Thu Oct 12, 2006 10:59 pm Post subject:
post.author: zl1corvette
post.body:
declmanager.h wrote:

// If makeDefault is true, a default decl of appropriate type will be created
// if an explicit one isn't found. If makeDefault is false, NULL will be returned
// if the decl wasn't explcitly defined.


so
Code:
FindSkin("myskin",false)
